data.title: Timeline
data.meta_description: It is unknown in which exact year Lifeline discovers her parents' true careers as war profiteers and leaves Psamathe with Octane for a short trip. After meeting the punk band, The Flyer Liars, and stayed on as a drummer for about half a year, Ajay leaves her house for good and joins the Frontier...
data.text:
Date Events Source ~2080 Heinrich Hammond is born on Earth. [1] 2122 Sheffield's Asteroid impacts St. Louis, Missouri. Heinrich Hammond survives exposure to a powerful unknown element inside it. [2] 2127 Heinrich Hammond founds Hammond Engineering. [2] 2131 Heinrich Hammond founds Hammond Robotics. [3] 2187 Hammond Engineering unveils the world's first interstellar jump drive, allowing for the colonization of other planets in the Core Systems. [2] 2192 For 100 years, Hammond Engineering sneakily coordinates business mergers and acquisitions of most other major corporations in the Core Systems. This results in the creation of the Interstellar Manufacturing Corporation. [2] 2292 The discovery of the Frontier sparks the New Space Race. The IMC sends many colony ships across the distance and the ones that make it found the first settlements in the Frontier. [2] 2300s The Outlands is discovered and colonized. [4] 2356 Kaleb Cross is born somewhere in the Outlands. [5] 2400 Kaleb Cross is killed by Bob Woods in Zaldana City, Gaea. His corpse is subsequently rushed to a Hammond Robotics facility for preservation. [5] 2420 Revenant's brain is uploaded into a simulacrum body for the first time. Hammond higher-ups disregard potential stability issues. [6] 2442 The Corporate Wars begin. The IMC goes to war in the Core Systems against rival corporations and is forced to leave the Frontier to its own devices. [2] 2445 The company AI Logic is founded in Angel City, Angelia. [2] 2525 The Search and Rescue Association of Solace (SARAS) is founded by the Gibraltar family. [4] 2560 A cult allegedly followed Revenant during this decade. [5] 2609 Mary Somers is born on Psamathe. 2613 Ashleigh Reid is born somewhere in the Frontier. 2640 Olympus is constructed with funding from billionaire Lillian Peck. [7] 2643 Project Iris is founded. [5] 2645 Torres Silva is born. [8] 2646 Dr. Mary Somers and Dr. Ashleigh Reid successfully extract branthium from a black hole. Dr. Reid then disconnects Somers' tether and leaves her to die. Somers manages to escape, but where she only experienced 246 days, 87 years had actually passed. [9] 2654 Project Iris assembles a group of scientists to find a way to refine branthium into a reliable energy source. [10] 2655 An energy crisis affects the Outlands. This same year, the Witt family comes to own the Paradise Lounge in Solace City. [11] 2658

February 4: Pathfinder is assembled and activated by the scientists of Project Iris.

December 25:

An attempted theft of branthium resulted in the Phase Runner accident in Olympus, causing the demise of the scientists working on Project Iris and created a massive rift to appear on the floating city, eventually rendering it unfit for habitation. Pathfinder's earliest memory of Dr. Amélie Paquette occurs here.

All at once, large amounts of branthium are discovered around the Outlands. These deposits are then used to prevent the energy crisis.

Dr. Ashleigh Reid is converted into a simulacrum. The operation splits her personality in two, with her more empathetic personality suppressed by her ego retention system.

[12][13][14][15] 2667 Marcos Andrade is born on Talos. [16] 2671 The Titan Wars begin. The IMC returns to the Frontier and attempts to reassert control, but faces resistance from the Frontier Militia. [2] 2672 August Montgomery Brinkman is born on Gaea. 2679 Margaret "Maggie" Kōhere is born on Salvo. 2680 Walter Fitzroy is born on Salvo. 2685 February 25: Alexander Nox is born in Hollygrove, Gaea. [17] 2687 Jack Cooper is born on Earth. 2692 The Titan Wars end. The IMC overpowers the Militia and leaves only one fleet left. [2] 2694 Jackson Williams is born on Gridiron. 2695

Anita Williams is born on Gridiron.

Blódhundr is born on Talos.

2699 Loba Andrade is born somewhere in the Outlands. 2700 Pathfinder wakes up in an abandoned warehouse on Solace. 2701 December 21: Renee Hope Blasey is born on an alternate dimension's Typhon. [18] 2702 Marcos Andrade commits a heist at the Ivy Vale Chateau, putting his name on the map as a big-time thief. 2703

Makoa Gibraltar and Elliott Witt are born, both on Solace.

The Thunderdome is first built in Kings Canyon.

Branthium is discovered on Talos. Bloodhound and their parents move to World's Edge for work at the New Dawn coolant plant. After their death in a flash freeze, a young Bloodhound is taken in by their uncle Artur and his tribe.

[19][14] 2704 Kairi Imahara is born on Angelia. 2705

James McCormick is born.

Tressa Crystal Smith is born on Boreas.

Sok Leng Phua and Kit Siang Phua start competing in the Thunderdome.

[20][21] 2707

The Frontier War begins. With new intel on the IMC, the Militia can rebuild its forces and strike back.

August Brinkman starts competing in the Thunderdome.

[2][21] 2708

Obi Edolasim is born on Boreas, as a meteor collides with the planet's moon.

Ignacio Huamani is born on Solace.

Rowenna Valentina Coffey Divina is born on Nexus.

Protests break out against Hammond Robotics' continued work on simulacra.

Revenant murders Marcos and Alanza Andrade at Tenmei in Olympus. A shard of glass stuck in his neck causes his Ego Retention System to fail, allowing him to realize he is a simulacrum. Both Loba and Pathfinder witness this event.

[22][23][12] 2709 Ajay Che and Octavio Silva are born, both on Psamathe. 2710

The events of Titanfall's campaign take place. The Militia destroys the Demeter Gateway, leaving the IMC's forces stranded in the Frontier without backup.

Kuben Blisk fights his last fight at the Thunderdome.

Bloodhound's uncle Artur dies fighting a Goliath. Bloodhound slays the Goliath, but in the process suffers lung damage from inhaling coolant.

[24][14][25] 2711

Natalie Paquette is born on Solace. Her mother dies before her first birthday.

Tae Joon Park is born on Gaea.

Linh My Vo is born on Solace.

The Frontier Corps is founded.

Nexus's IMC-backed government is overthrown in a coup, being replaced with a tyrannical monarchy.

[26][2][27] 2712

Ramya Parekh is born on Gaea.

Hope is founded on Cleo.

2713

The IMC begins to pull funding and personnel from the Outlands to focus on the Frontier.

Bloodhound meets Boone and later witnesses his death to the beast they caught.

[4][14] 2714

The IMC begins intervening against the monarchy on Nexus.

[4][14][27] 2715

The events of Titanfall 2's campaign take place. The planet Typhon is destroyed when the Militia sabotages the IMC's Fold Weapon. Several Apex Predator members are killed.

A communications blackout occurs in the Frontier.

Pathfinder gets a job as a weather reporter.

Icarus Fleet is sent to Typhon by Silva Pharmaceuticals to sift through wreckage and grab anything of value. Fleet is considered lost at that time.

Battle of Gridiron took place. Jackson Williams, viewing the battle as lost, ordered Hestia-01's retreat.

Cleo becomes habitable.

The IMC recalls their military from the Outlands.

[12][note 1][1][4][12][28][27] 2716

Xiomara Contreras is born on Págos.

In the power vacuum left by the IMC, the Outlands Civil War begins.

Anita Williams awakens from stasis. Commander Scryer attacks a settlement on Storm Point after receiving a distress signal announcing the presence of IMC deserter Jackson Williams.

The monarchy on Nexus publicly executes hundreds of political dissidents.

[24]

[29][30][note 2][27][note 3] 2717

Gibraltar, distraught with his parents' ambivalence regarding the Outlands Civil War, runs away from home. He finds work at the Thunderdome and meets Nik, with the two soon entering a relationship.

Gibraltar and Nik steal the former's father's motorcycle, intending to enlist to fight in the war. The two are trapped in a mudslide, with SARAS needing to come to the rescue. As a result, Gibraltar's father loses an arm and Nik is sent to juvenile detention.

The monarchy of Nexus is overthrown in a series of battles. During one such battle, a Monarch-class Titan detonates its battery, destroying the encroacing armies and much of the surrounding area. The impacted area is barricaded as a quarantine zone afterwards.

[31][27] 2718 Kit Siang Phua is killed in the Thunderdome. [21] 2719

The IMC leaves Solace, the final planet in the Outlands they had been operating on, and the Thunderdome is closed.

Solace Military's transport vessel Crimson goes down over Gaea. On board was all of Mirage's three brothers, all of whom are pronounced MIA.

Tressa Smith and Margo sneak into a Hammond Robotics facility on Boreas, where the latter triggers a bomb.

Smith joins the Cleo Recovery Council as a terraformer.

[4][24][32] 2720

Earliest date at which the planetwide curfew on Boreas is lifted.

The Blackout reaches the Outlands.

December 28th: Octane receives a rabbit for Christmas, who he names Navidad.

[4][33] 2721

An attack on the Hestia II results in the presumed death of Jackson Williams.

[34][note 4][35][36] 2722 Salvo rejects the Mercenary Syndicate's offer to join Syndicate Space. [37] 2723

The Outlands Civil War ends. Planets that sign the Mercenary Syndicate Treaty become Syndicate Space; those that don't become the Fringe Worlds.

As part of the treaty, the Thunderdome Games are to be revived in Kings Canyon. Luc Paquette is hired to build the new games' power grid.

In Zaldana City, Gaea, Dr. Franklin Humbert discovers Alexander Nox's experiments and confronts him. Nox kills Humbert and burns the laboratory down, faking his own death in the process. Pathfinder witnesses this.

Tae Joon Park is adopted by Katerina Ticacek “Mystik” Nox at the age of 12.

[17][12][2][38][39] 2725

Pathfinder and Victor Maldera get in a fight with several mobsters in Malta, Psamathe. Pathfinder discovers his own memory logs of Dr. Amélie, but the files are damaged before he can learn much.

June 10: Seer fights his first Arenas match.

[12][40] 2726

April 9: Loba Andrade and Jaime steal an antique fan and two jewels from the Chenosky Auction House on Psamathe.

[41] 2727

Jackson Williams marries a woman. During his wedding night, he records a video in hope of sending it to his parents on Gridiron.

Wraith escapes the Kings Canyon facility she was imprisoned in by switching dimensions with her alternate self. In this dimension, the Apex Games are being constructed on the surface.

Thanks to a flash drive given by an informant, Anita Williams travels to Singh Labs on Kings Canyon where she plugs the drive and sees a video recording of Jackson. The flash drive was stolen by an alternate Wraith

Wattson tests her prototype for The Ring in Kings Canyon. Lightning strikes the generator and burns the surrounding forest down. She is saved by Wraith.

[42][43][38][10] 2728

Nik Gentile sues his ex-wife, Vanessa, for sole custody of their son.

[44][31] 2729

The Apex Games begin. Luc Paquette dies a month prior, and Wattson's work on The Ring is completed.[note 5]

Pathfinder starts competing in the Apex Games.

A body that matches Jackson Williams's body is recovered on Solace by this time.

In retaliation against her ex-husband, Vanessa tells Michael Gentile about the incident that got his father into detention, causing the boy to despise Gibraltar.

[45][46][47][48] 2730 Renee Blasey, Makoa Gibraltar, and Anita Williams begin competing in the Apex Games. [21] 2731

Ajay Che and Alexander Nox begin competing in the Apex Games.

While working as a contractor for the Apex Broadcasts Monitoring System, Tae Joon Park uncovers a prediction algorithm for the Apex Games. His foster sister, Mila, was then abducted and he was framed for her supposed murder.

Fuse becomes the oldest competitor to qualify for the Bonecage at 51.

Valkyrie gets a smuggling job from Kuben Blisk to retrieve her father's Northstar.

A fire at a morgue on Solace destroys the records of the site of Jackson Williams's burial.

May 3rd: Larissa Craig, Jackson Williams' daughter, is born.

[49][50][51][52][53][45][54][21] 2732 Elliott Witt and Bloodhound begin competing in the Apex Games. [21] 2733 Seasons 0-7 2734 Seasons 8-15 2735 Current year. [55] Date Events Source Season 1

The Apex Games notes an unprecedented 60% increase in new competitors registering.

Octane tries out for the Apex Games.

[19] Season 2

Crypto sneaks into Kings Canyon mid-match and detonates an EMP to take down the Repulsor tower, flooding the arena with local wildlife.

The Mercenary Syndicate has a "run-in" with a rival organization on Talos.

Octane constructs his gauntlet in Kings Canyon.

Wraith unearths Singh Labs and recovers several documents about her past life.

Crypto continues to damage the Kings Canyon's infrastructure, causing the Syndicate to consider new arenas.

[56][57] Season 3

Crypto sneaks his credentials into the Apex Games' systems, under the name Hyeon Kim.

For the first match in World's Edge, Crypto and Mirage are put in a squad together, sparking their rivalry.

Pathfinder accidentally enters the beta plane shadow dimension and meets an alternate universe Revenant.

Mirage parks his party boat in World's Edge.

[58][59][60][61] Season 4

Forge announces his intent to become the next Apex Legend. He is immediately killed by Revenant live on television.

Syndicate higher-ups decide to put Revenant into the Apex Games to satiate his bloodlust.

Hammond Robotics installs a new planet harvester in the middle of World's Edge.

Bloodhound opens Bloodhound's Trials in World's Edge to combat the growing prowler population.

[3][62][63] Season 5

Jaime and Loba discover that Revenant has joined the Apex Games, and begins infiltrating Kings Canyon facilities to gather information.

August: While preparing to leave Psamathe, "The Widow" visited Loba and Jaime's apartment for a job offer, only to find Loba had unilaterally ended the contract.

Loba destroys an underground warehouse full of Revenant bodies, destroying Skull Town in the process. Syndicate and Hammond officials immediately welcome her into the Apex Games.

Loba enlists the help of the other Legends to acquire pieces of an artifact from the beta plane that is ruled by Shadow Revenant. Caustic leaks information about this to the current Revenant.

Mila Alexander sneaks messages to Crypto via Kings Canyon's excavated IMC bunkers. She assures him that she's safe and hiding.

Upon finding all pieces of the artifact, it turns out to be Ash's head. Now rebuilt, Ash initiates the Games' transfer to Olympus.

[64][26] Season 6

Big Sister's gang assaults Rampart and burns down her shop on Gaea. As reward for putting up a fight, Kuben Blisk grants her a free pass into the Apex Games.

Hammond constructs the Arcadia rocket in World's Edge to transfer scientific equipment and supplies to Olympus.

Mirage, low on money, removes his party boat from World's Edge and agrees to let Rampart operate out of the Paradise Lounge.

Ash stays in Pathfinder's warehouse for some time, but ends up vanishing with Kuben Blisk.

Crypto acquires an encrypted comm unit with a line to Mila Alexander, which was stolen from Syndicate Official Quentin Willis, resulting in a night of scrimmage. Willis' scheme to fix the Apex Games was revealed to the public, and soon he was killed by Revenant. As the comm unit was damaged, Crypto vowed to repair it.

[65][66][67] Season 7

After Mirage accidentally puts all of Rampart's stuff on the Arcadia rocket, the two chase after it and arrive early to the new arena in Olympus.

Horizon returns to Psamathe and joins the Apex Games to fund her time travel research.

Pathfinder, Gibraltar, Lifeline, and Octane attend a Chevrex charity event to get a battery for a century-old MRVN. The party is attacked by Creighton Sawtelle.

During a bathroom break, Octane finds out that the terrorist attack at the party is orchestrated by his father, Duardo Silva. Wishing to keep it a secret, he left the truth to Lifeline's drone D.O.C, who recorded the whole confession.

The battery activates a MRVN found in Hammond Labs with a recording of Dr. Amélie.

November: Loba acquires Revenant's source code and asks Jaime to throw it into a phase runner to Gridiron. Jaime opts to keep the source code instead.

Crypto reveals to Wattson his identity to mend their relationship.

Horizon finds recordings of her son Newton that confirm her time travel research will be successful.

Pathfinder interviews his fellow legends to figure out who his creators were and what he was built for.

Salvo, under new leadership, retracts its previous agreements and becomes the seventh planet under Syndicate jurisdiction.

Mirage's party ship is parked in Kings Canyon.

[68][69][37][70][71] Season 8

Current year is now 2734.

Sandringham Kelly, now the Supreme Warlord of Salvo, signs a treaty with the Syndicate to make Salvo a Syndicate Space planet.

Thanks to Fuse's success in Salvo's Bonecage, he is accepted into the Apex Games. Enraged, his friend Maggie blows his arm off with a grenade.

During Fuse's welcoming ceremony, Maggie hacks into Fuse's ship and causes it to fire on the crowd. She then detonates several explosives in the mountains, and the ship crashes north of Artillery.

Maggie publicly demands the legends bring her Fuse's other arm. Fuse, Lifeline, and Bloodhound go to confront her. They ended up leaving her hideout in Kings Canyon.

Caustic gets approval to rebuild Water Treatment into his own toxin refining laboratory. He makes plans for an experiment that will affect all of Solace City, but is thwarted by Wattson.

Maggie hijacks control of the Games and causes Ring Flares throughout matches.

After another confrontation between Fuse and Maggie, the latter falls off of a rooftop, seemingly to her death.

[72][73][74] Season 9

Events in this season happen around April 2734.

Mirage crashes the Mirage Voyage into Kómma, a city on Solace. Ash obtains the area and uses it for the Arenas.[75]

Pathfinder's role in solving the Outland Energy Crisis was made known to the public, and a dedication ceremony is held on Olympus.

The Icarus Fleet docks on Olympus. Huge, apparently indestructible vines come out from the ships in the fleet, spreading a mysterious deadly illness.

Due to an audio recording from D.O.C, Lifeline discovers from that Duardo Silva was the one who sent the Icarus Fleet to Olympus and caused the crisis. Lifeline confronts Duardo, though she backs down when she learns that Octane was forced into scrubbing the Silva Pharmaceuticals logo from the Icarus.

Thanks to the efforts of the Legends, the deadly Medusa Vines were thwarted and a cure was made for the people who were infected.

Not leaving empty-handed, Lifeline and Octane put the Silva Pharmaceuticals logo on the Icarus again. in hopes to have the public turn on Duardo Silva. However, Duardo denies the allegations, claiming these are all efforts of the Syndicate to undermine him for their failures and asserts they need new leadership.

[76][77] Season 10

Obi Edolasim, a famed Arenas fighter, joins the Apex Games.

After months of aggressive mining by the Harvester, World's Edge is pushed to its limit, resulting in tremors, landslides, and an increase in lava fissures. In response, Hammond Robotics constructs the Lava Siphon and Climatizer as an empty gesture to mitigate the damage.

Burdened by guilt over the state of their homeworld, Bloodhound faces the manifestation of their guilt and overcomes it, regaining their confidence.

Mary Somers forcibly awakens the human identity of Ash.

Season 11

The island of Storm Point is acquired by the Syndicate as a new arena for the Apex Games.

Ash joins the Apex Games to search for information about her past, as well as to confirm to herself that she has cast aside her humanity.

Ash and Tae Joon Park form a partnership.

A dogfight occurs between the Syndicate and a Cracked Talon fighter. The Cracked Talon aircraft is defeated, and its wreckage lands on Olympus and Storm Point.

Lisa Stone airs a series of podcasts on Outlands TV, sponsored by Silva Pharmaceuticals, to support Eduardo Silva's campaign to lead the Syndicate.

Season 12

Margaret "Mad Maggie" Kōhere is apprehended by the Syndicate on Olympus and is sentenced to death in the Apex Games.

During Maggie's first match, Eduardo Silva activates a program to phase Olympus above the skyline of Malta, causing damage to the floating city.

Octavio Silva decides to repair his relationship with his father in order to find out his plan for the Outlands. He eventually learns that his father has been dead for years, and his grandfather, Torres, has taken on his identity. During this time, his friendship with Ajay Che is broken.

Torres Silva, masquerading as Eduardo, is elected as the Syndicate's sole leader. As his first action, he acquires the Frontier Corps and rebrands it as the more militarized Syndicate Corps, placing Cherisse Che at its head.

Ajay forms a partnership with Maggie.

Renee Blasey discovers records that indicate that Jackson Williams is dead. A distraught Anita Williams decides to leave the Apex Games and return home to Gridiron.

Season 13

Newcastle is killed by members of the Forgotten Families. Seeing a threat to the town of Harris Valley, Jackson Williams works out a deal with them to bear the mantle of Newcastle and pay off his debts by competing in the Apex Games.

During Anita Williams's supposed final match, a large beast attacks Storm Point. While fighting off the beast, she discovers that Newcastle, her replacement, is Jackson.

After eavesdropping on an argument between Anita and Jackson, Renee Blasey and Elliott Witt set out to investigate Newcastle, wondering who the new competitor is and why Anita desided to remain in the Outlands. This leads Renee, Elliott, and Anita to a fight with the Forgotten Families in a warehouse outside of Harris Valley.

During a block party in Harris Valley, Anita discovers that Jackson has forged a new life and family in the town.

Elliott steals an ARES Division document from the Forgotten Families, detailing a test subject experimented on by Dr. Renee H. Blasey.

Obi Edolasim is invited to an interview with Lisa Stone of Outlands TV. The interview takes a sharp turn when Lisa uses the interview as a character assassination against Obi.

Season 14

Xiomara Contreras suffers a severe injury on Págos. Her mother Xenia, a supposed traitor during the Outlands Civil War, activates a distress beacon to save her daughter. Xiomara is rescued and Xenia is arrested by Gaean authorities.

Xiomara joins the Apex Games to bring attention to Xenia's wrongful imprisonment.

Seeing her lack of social skills, Elliott Witt assists Xiomara in making friends.

Natalie Paquette repairs the damaged communications unit, which connects to Mila Alexander. Mila tells Natalie to keep their meeting a secret and to not tell her brother that the unit is repaired.

Mass protests break out on Boreas in response to a lack of action toward preserving the dying world.

Bloodhound and their village relocate to Storm Point.

Jaime is attacked by an unknown assailant who came for Revenant's source code. He was left for dead in Kairi Imahara's apartment with the assailant taking the source code with them. Jaime was later discovered strung by the wrists by Loba. The culprit later made plans to deliver the source code to their contact.

Kairi Imahara visits Revenant in an underground bunker at Kings Canyon and reveals to him that his source code was not sent to Gridiron at all and promises its location if he agrees to stay away from Loba. Revenant agrees to the deal.

Witt hosts a party at the Paradise Lounge.

Obi Edolasim and Octavio Silva work together on a proposal for expanding the Apex Games to Boreas to Torres Silva, who later accepts the proposal.

Season 15

The Mercenary Syndicate acquires the colony of Hope on Cleo, the moon of Boreas, as the newest arena for the Apex Games. As a result, the services of the Cleo Recovery Council within Hope are terminated.

Tressa Crystal Smith, a terraformer for the CRC, joins the Apex Games to try to find a new source of financial stability.

As a result of Cleo being used as an Apex Games arena, Obi Edolasim becomes the target of a lot of ire and anger by the Boreas's populace.

The home of Seer's parents was attacked by angry protestors, blaming them for recent events as well as their son. Torres Silva brought them to a safehouse to keep them safe from the protests.

Season 16

Current year is now 2735.

Torres Silva hosts an anniversary celebration for the Apex Games.

The Sisters become an officially licensed business, releasing the Nemesis Burst AR as their first product.

Ajay Che tries to recruit Tae Joon Park, Bloodhound, and Walter Fitzroy for an operation against the Syndicate. She only managed to recruit Park.

During a party held at the Silva estate, Che infiltrates Torres Silva's computer and uses Park's drive to look for information. She learns that the Syndicate Corps are handling an off-the-books operation on Salvo.

Che and Fitzroy venture to Salvo, where they have a fight with remnants of the Cracked Talon.

Makoa Gibraltar rescues Michael Gentile from a Trident crash in a lake on Solace.

Xiomara Contreras and her bat companion Echo visit a public zoo in Gaea.

Ash and Pathfinder fight together during an Apex Games match set in Olympus. After getting hit by Crypto's EMP, Ash went unconscious reliving one of her past memories, causing the pair to lose the match.

Ramya Parekh is visited at her shop by Frances, who offers her a place back in The Sisters. Parekh angrily refuses.

Che breaks Margaret Kōhere out of prison. Together, the two depart for Salvo.

Ajay Che disables a security camera and knocks out a prison guard, helping Margaret Kohere breaks out of her prison and make departure for Salvo.

Season 17

Nathaniel Phua qualifies for the Apex Games. To stop his son from following the same path as him, August Montgomery Brinkman confronts Torres Silva and forces him to allow him in instead.

On Salvo, Ajay Che, Margaret Kōhere, and Loba Andrade break into a fortified bunker with ties to Torres Silva, finding evidence of similar facilities across the Outlands. Loba sneaks off and finds a facility constructing Revenant's bodies. The three fight their way out and are carried away by Kairi Imahara.

Tae Joon Park works to decrypt the data extracted by Maggie and her co-conspirators.

Torres Silva assigns Mila Alexander to surveil the Legends' efforts against him.

A massive storm approaches Storm Point.

Revenant receives a heavily upgraded chassis as a result of research by Hammond Robotics. Torres Silva quickly takes control of the project.

Season 18

Lifeline, Crypto, Revenant, Loba, Valkyrie, and Maggie infiltrate a Hammond Labs research facility on Malta with the intent of finding and destroying Revenant's source code, but fail despite their efforts.

Loba discovers Valkyrie's deal with Revenant to locate and destroy the simulacrum's source code, severely damaging their relationship.

Season 19

Storm Point fully recovers from the devastation caused by the storm with the help of Natalie Paquette.

Rowena Valentina Coffey Divina constructs a combat rig from the irradiated remains of a Monarch-class Titan and finds success in local combat rings on Nexus. To make money for her struggling family, she enters the Apex Games at the cost of her future health.

Torres Silva is murdered and Revenant reclaims his source code.
